> I understand that I can easily write my own assertion library in 

 > just a couple hours [...] As they are identified, it seems natural
 > for JUnit to provide them in future releases.

I agree on the "specification" but not on the "implementation".  The 
problem I see is in the release paste.  On the one hand, you have a 
framework that must stay stable, and on the other hand optional 
libraries that must be released more frequently.

The solution would be yet another project on sourceforge, with 
guidelines and organization, to be able to release often and only for 
the interested users (so no complain that some classes "pollute" JUnit).

Same thing for the generation of TestCase files.  Often the proposed 
solutions are not meant to be easily parameterized because they were 
developed for a certain environment.

Anyway, it's maybe time for somebody to step forward.  No, no don't look 
at me like that! :-)

-Vladimir
